item.title: How Mitchell Starc got rid of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill at Gabba - WATCH - The Times of India
item.description:
How Mitchell Starc got rid of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill at Gabba - WATCH

Date: NEW DELHI Source: Times of India

Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood dismantled India's top order, leaving the team struggling on Day 3 of the third Test at the Gabba. Starc dismissed both Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, contributing to India's woes.

  • Australia scored 445 runs in their first innings.
  • Mitchell Starc dismissed Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill on the same day.
  • Jaiswal's average against left-arm pacers is notably poor at 17.33.
  • Jasprit Bumrah took 6 wickets for 76 runs for India.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1.
"Jaiswal's struggles against left-arm pacers continue to haunt him, with six dismissals in nine Test innings."

The match remains tense, with the series finely balanced as each team aims for a crucial victory.

item.title: "Edged And Gone": Virat Kohli Repeats Same Mistakes, Triggers Epic Meme Fest - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Edged And Gone": Virat Kohli Repeats Same Mistakes, Triggers Epic Meme Fest

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Virat Kohli faced yet another disappointing dismissal during India’s tour of Australia, falling for just three runs as he chased an outside-off delivery from Josh Hazlewood.

  • Kohli continues to struggle with his form in Australia, often getting out to deliveries outside off stump.
  • This dismissal marks a continuation of his issues throughout the series.
  • Despite his poor run, fans have taken to social media to humorously critique his performances.
"Edged, caught behind the stumps, and gone" - cricket.com.au

In the innings, India faced a challenging situation at 22 for three, following a strong Australian first innings score of 445.

item.title: IND vs AUS: 'Virat Kohli should learn from MS Dhoni and retire' - Indian run machine flops again - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS: 'Virat Kohli should learn from MS Dhoni and retire' - Indian run machine flops again

Date: Not Provided Source: Times of India

India's star batter Virat Kohli is under fire for his poor performance following another low score during the third Test against Australia at the Gabba, Brisbane.

  • Kohli was dismissed for only 3 runs after edging the ball to wicketkeeper Alex Carey.
  • This marks the latest in a series of disappointing performances, with scores of 5, 100*, 7, and 11 in the current series.
  • Fans are vocally criticizing his recent form, with some calling for his retirement.
  • Despite a century in the second Test, Kohli has struggled overall in the series.
Fans took to social media to express their frustration, urging the player to consider retirement.

In conclusion, Virat Kohli's recent performances have led to significant disappointment among fans, stirring debate about his future in international cricket.

item.title: Isa Guha Apologises Over 'Racist Remark' On Jasprit Bumrah, Ravi Shastri Reacts - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Isa Guha Apologises Over 'Racist Remark' On Jasprit Bumrah, Ravi Shastri Reacts

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV

The incident occurred during commentary of the third Test between India and Australia, where Isa Guha mentioned Jasprit Bumrah in a controversial manner. This led to a public backlash, prompting Guha to issue an apology on live television.

  • Isa Guha referred to Jasprit Bumrah as a 'primate' while praising his bowling skills.
  • She later clarified that her remark was meant to be a compliment, stating she admires Bumrah greatly.
  • Guha apologised for any offense caused, emphasizing her commitment to empathy and inclusivity.
  • Ravi Shastri praised Guha's decision to apologise publicly, calling it a brave move.
A very genuine apology from Isa Guha. — Dan News (@dannews)

Guha expressed hope that her comment did not overshadow the ongoing Test match and reiterated her lack of malice in the statement.

item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 3 Live Score: Rain forces players off 4th time shortly after start of second session

Publication Date: December 16, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Rain has interrupted the third day of the Test match between India and Australia multiple times, impacting the flow of play as both teams battle for supremacy in the series.

  • India was reduced to 22/3 at lunch, trailing by 423 runs.
  • Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill both fell early, with poor shot selection being a critical factor.
  • Australia scored a total of 445 runs, with Travis Head and Steve Smith dominating on Day 2.
  • Alex Carey was key to Australia's innings, securing a half-century efficiently.
  • Multiple rain delays have disrupted both innings, with players forced off the field repeatedly.
“One would say it is poor shot selection. You can say that they have bowled well and they have pitched it up but if you look at the three dismissals, none of them were great deliveries.” – Cheteshwar Pujara

As the match progresses, the focus falls on India's performance in batting to recover from a fragile position.

item.title: Rohit Sharma's captaincy exposed again; Shastri, Vaughan baffled after Kohli placement: 'That can cost you big time' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's captaincy exposed again; Shastri, Vaughan baffled after Kohli placement: 'That can cost you big time'

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The second day of the third Test against Australia has once again put Rohit Sharma's captaincy under scrutiny as experts question his field placements against Travis Head.

  • Travis Head scores a second consecutive century against India.
  • Former cricketers Ravi Shastri and Michael Vaughan express their confusion over Sharma's field placements.
  • Shastri criticizes the strategy of prioritizing containment over aggression.
  • Vaughan suggests a lack of consistent tactics throughout the match.
“When you see the field set, that can cost you big time.” - Ravi Shastri

This match raises important questions about strategy and decision-making in high-stakes cricket as India struggles under Sharma's leadership.

item.title: ‘I’m not good enough': Pep Guardiola takes the blame as Manchester City lose to Manchester United - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pep Guardiola Takes Responsibility for Manchester City's Defeat to Manchester United

Date: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Pep Guardiola expressed his disappointment and took the blame for Manchester City's recent 2-1 defeat against Manchester United, marking a difficult period for the team.

  • Manchester City led the match with a goal from Josko Gvardiol.
  • Late goals from Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo sealed the win for Manchester United.
  • This loss signifies City's eighth defeat in 11 games, raising concerns about team performance.
  • Guardiola admitted he is struggling to find solutions and feels personally responsible for the team's struggles.
  • His recent two-year contract extension adds pressure to turn the team's fortunes around.
  • Ruben Amorim praised his team's performance and confidence in the win over City.
“I’m the manager and I’m not good enough, simple as that.” - Pep Guardiola

The defeat adds to the pressure on Guardiola as he attempts to restore Manchester City's form amidst growing concerns from fans and analysts alike.

item.title: D Gukesh opens up on future after becoming chess world champion: 'Main goal I have had is being the best in the world' - Firstpost
item.description:
D Gukesh opens up on future after becoming chess world champion: 'Main goal I have had is being the best in the world'

Publication Date: Recent, Source: Firstpost

D Gukesh has made history by becoming the youngest world champion in chess after defeating Ding Liren 7.5-6.5 in the recent FIDE World Championship. His focus now shifts toward future endeavors while he enjoys the moment with family and friends.

  • D Gukesh won the championship with a scoreline of 7.5-6.5, clinching victory in Game 14.
  • At 18, he became the youngest world champion ever, breaking a 39-year-old record previously held by Garry Kasparov.
  • He expressed that while becoming a world champion is significant, his ultimate goal is to be recognized as the best player in the world.
  • Motivated by top players like Magnus Carlsen and Fabiano Caruana, Gukesh aims for continuous improvement and excellence in the sport.
“The main goal I have had is being the best in the world and achieving my full potential.” - D Gukesh

In summary, Gukesh's triumph marks not just a personal achievement but also positions him as a significant figure in the chess community with aspirations for even greater accomplishments.

item.title: Barcelona are all over the place! La Liga leaders suffer shocking home defeat to Leganes as Robert Lewandowski forgets shooting boots & Lamine Yamal endures rare off-night - GOAL English
item.description:
Barcelona are all over the place! La Liga leaders suffer shocking home defeat to Leganes

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Goal.com

Barcelona faced an unexpected defeat at home against Leganes, raising concerns over their current form as they continue to struggle in La Liga.

  • Barcelona, the La Liga leaders, unexpectedly lost to Leganes.
  • Robert Lewandowski failed to convert scoring opportunities.
  • Lamine Yamal had an unusually off night.
  • The defeat puts pressure on Barcelona to regain their previous form.
“We have to evaluate what went wrong and correct it as soon as possible,” a club representative stated.

This defeat emphasizes the vulnerability of Barcelona despite their position on the league table, suggesting a need to reassess their tactics moving forward.

item.title: Anushka Sharma Shares Heartfelt Reaction To Gukesh Dommaraju’s Father’s Inspiring Video; See Here - News18
item.description:
Anushka Sharma's Heartfelt Response to Gukesh Dommaraju's Father's Inspiring Video

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: News18

Anushka Sharma shared her heartfelt reaction to a touching video of Gukesh Dommaraju’s father, Dr. Rajnikanth, who spoke about the sacrifices made to help his son achieve success as the youngest world champion in chess.

  • Anushka praised Dr. Rajnikanth's perspective on parenting, viewing it as a responsibility rather than a sacrifice.
  • Dr. Rajnikanth quit his job as an ENT surgeon to support Gukesh Dommaraju's chess career after recognizing his son's potential.
  • Gukesh Dommaraju defeated defending champion Ding Liren to secure his title at age 18.
  • Anushka's recent posts indicate she balances her family life with social media, sharing moments with her children and husband, Virat Kohli.
“Beautiful words by a champion parent,” – Anushka Sharma.

This heartfelt reaction highlights the importance of support in pursuing dreams, reflecting Anushka's values in family and dedication.

item.title: Man United 2-1 Man City (15 Dec, 2024) Game Analysis - ESPN India
item.description:
Manchester United Stuns Manchester City with Late Goals in Derby Win

Date: 15 Dec, 2024 | Source: ESPN (IN)

Manchester United delivered a shocking late comeback against Manchester City, winning 2-1 in a thrilling Premier League derby.

  • Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo scored late goals to secure the victory for United.
  • City initially took the lead with a header from Josko Gvardiol.
  • Fernandes converted a penalty in the 88th minute after Diallo was fouled.
  • Diallo then scored a spectacular goal moments later to seal the win.
  • This marks a significant low for City, now having lost eight of their last eleven matches.
  • United hopes this victory will boost their season as they navigate through the festive period.

"The second half, we pressed good, we wanted to win... we showed today we can win every game and we are very happy to win today," - Amad Diallo

In light of this match, City’s struggles continue, leading to serious questions about their form and strategy moving forward.

item.description:

Date: [Insert Publication Date]   Source: [Insert Source]

In a challenging matchup, Chelsea secured a 2-1 victory against Brentford, showcasing their growth in confidence and consistency. Key players like Marc Cucurella and Nicolas Jackson played pivotal roles in the game.

  • Brentford has been a difficult opponent for Chelsea in recent seasons.
  • Moisés Caicedo contributed significantly with his long passes despite his defensive role.
  • Chelsea dominated possession and created several scoring opportunities, particularly in the first half.

“Carefree!”

This match highlights Chelsea's progress under pressure, although they remain capable of improvement as they prepare for upcoming challenges.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Goes Past Zaheer & Ishant's Tally To Take No. 2 Position In Elite List Led By Kapil Dev - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Surges to No. 2 in India's Elite Five-Wicket Haul List

Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

Star Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah shone during the second day of the third Test against Australia, taking five wickets for 72 runs, surpassing Zaheer Khan and Ishant Sharma to secure the No. 2 spot for most five-wicket hauls among Indian pacers in Test history.

  • Bumrah achieved his 12th five-wicket haul in Tests, moving past Zaheer and Ishant's 11.
  • He dismissed notable players including Steve Smith (101) and Travis Head (152) in a single over.
  • Bumrah is now the leading bowler with eight five-wicket hauls in SENA countries, surpassing Kapil Dev's seven.
  • He has equaled Anil Kumble's tally of 49 wickets in Australia, aiming to break Kapil Dev’s record of 51 in the ongoing series.
  • This fifer is Bumrah's 9th in the World Test Championship, tying with Pat Cummins for the most by a fast bowler.
“Bumrah has displayed extraordinary bowling skills, becoming a crucial asset for the Indian cricket team.”

In conclusion, Jasprit Bumrah's recent performance not only cements his status among India's elite bowlers but also makes him a pivotal figure in the future landscape of Test cricket.

item.title: Maia Bouchier: from dad's couch to Test crease - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Maia Bouchier: from dad's couch to Test crease

Published on: Sun, Dec 15, 2024, 05:54 PM | Source: Cricbuzz

Maia Bouchier made a memorable Test debut for England against South Africa, scoring a century and becoming only the fourth player to do so on debut.

  • Bouchier scored 126 runs, making her the fourth English player to score a century on debut.
  • Her score was briefly the fastest hundred for England, achieved off 124 balls, until it was surpassed shortly after.
  • She partnered with Nat Sciver-Brunt to form a significant partnership of 174 runs.
  • Her father, Anthony Bouchier, was present in the stands to witness her historic moment.
  • She expressed her pride and joy about the day and her father's emotions during a press conference.
“I'm super proud of myself and I know he's proud of me, so that's all I can hope for.”

Bouchier’s achievement marks a significant milestone in her career and adds to the growing narratives of women's cricket advancements globally.

item.title: BCCI in need of new treasurer with Ashish Shelar set to step down - Cricbuzz
item.description:
BCCI in Need of New Treasurer as Ashish Shelar Set to Step Down

Date: Sun, Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Cricbuzz

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is set to find a new treasurer as Ashish Shelar, currently in the position, will step down after taking a ministerial role in the Maharashtra Cabinet, which is against BCCI’s constitutional rules.

  • Shelar has served as treasurer since September 2022.
  • His resignation is the second departure of a BCCI office-bearer in two weeks.
  • The BCCI constitution disqualifies individuals from office if they hold a ministerial position.
  • Shelar previously confirmed he would not be taking on a more demanding role within BCCI due to his political commitments.
  • Questions remain on whether BCCI will elect a new treasurer or if responsibilities will be delegated.
“A person shall be disqualified from being an office-bearer... if he or she is: a Minister or a Government Servant.”

This transition within the BCCI comes at a pivotal time, influencing its governance as it navigates future leadership and responsibilities.

item.title: Nidhi stands tall as India retain Women’s Asia Cup with victory over three-time champs China - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Nidhi stands tall as India retain Women’s Asia Cup with victory over three-time champs China

Published on: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Nidhi's remarkable performance in the penalty shootout helped India defeat China 3-2, securing their second consecutive Women's Junior Asia Cup title.

  • India's goalkeeper Nidhi made three crucial saves in the shootout.
  • The match ended in a 1-1 draw after regulation time.
  • India's goals came from Kanika Siwach in the second half and Sunelita Toppo in the shootout.
  • Nidhi denied penalty attempts from China, showcasing her skills throughout the game.
Nidhi's heroics capped off a stellar performance, making crucial saves in both regulation and the shootout.

This victory not only highlights India's growing prowess in women's hockey but also showcases the talent of emerging players like Nidhi.

item.title: Rodrigues, Sadhu hand India big win on belter - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
India Secures a 49-Run Victory Over West Indies in T20I Series Opener

Publication Date: Recent
Source: ESPN Cricinfo

An aggressive performance with key partnerships gave India a 1-0 lead in the three-match T20I series against West Indies.

  • India scored 195 runs for 4 wickets, with Jemimah Rodrigues contributing a remarkable 73 runs off 35 balls.
  • Smriti Mandhana supported with a solid 54 runs, forming an 81-run partnership with Rodrigues.
  • West Indies managed 146 runs for 7 wickets, with Deandra Dottin scoring 52 runs.
  • Titas Sadhu took three important wickets, cementing her impact in the match.
  • The match showcased innovative batting strategies and strong fielding by India.
“Rodrigues stuck to her strengths, sweeping and reverse-sweeping from the get-go.”

India demonstrated strong batting and bowling, setting a challenging target for West Indies, ultimately leading to their victory.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah targeted with the racially sensitive remark in the third Test against Australia - Crictoday
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Faces Racist Remark During Third Test Against Australia

Date: Recent
Source: Cricket Today

Jasprit Bumrah's historic bowling performance was marred by a racially insensitive comment from former cricketer Isa Guha during the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25.

  • Bumrah took five wickets in Australia's first innings of the third Test.
  • Isa Guha made a controversial remark likening Bumrah to a primate after his exceptional performance.
  • Guha's comment has sparked widespread criticism on social media.
  • This incident draws parallels to a past racial controversy involving Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh.
“He’s the MVP and the most valuable Primate. He is going to do all the taking for his team.” - Isa Guha

The response to Guha's comment has been significant, highlighting ongoing issues of racism in sports commentary.
